column2: DE DRIVERS LICENSE TEST
column4: Delaware
column6: DE

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Drivers should check their rearview mirrors:
column4: only when slowing down.
column6: to see if a truck is in their blind spot.
column8: often to see how traffic is moving behind them.

column2: 2. After you stop for a school bus, you must:
column4: wait until the red lights stop flashing.
column6: pass the bus before the red lights stop flashing.
column8: turn off your engine.

column2: 3. If you meet a stopped school bus with the lights flashing and the signal arm extended, you should:
column4: proceed at 15 MPH or less, if no children are present.
column6: watch for children and proceed at normal speed.
column8: stop.

column2: 4. A steady yellow light means:
column4: Be prepared to stop for the red light.
column6: Drive with caution.
column8: Be prepared to go. The light will soon be green.

column2: 5. The driver of an emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can legally:
column4: exceed the speed limit
column6: pass red lights.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 6. A vehicle that enters a road from a driveway:
column4: must yield to traffic approaching from the right, while it has the right-of-way over vehicles approaching from the left.
column6: has the right-of-way.
column8: must stop and yield the right-of-way to traffic on the roadway and to pedestrians.

column2: 7. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Drivers have the right of way over bikes turning left.
column6: Motor vehicles entering an exclusive right-turn lane must weave across bicycle traffic in bicycle lanes.
column8: Vehicles turning left must yield to bikes entering a right turn lane.

column2: 8. What should you do if your rear wheels start to skid?
column4: Steer left if your rear wheels slide right.
column6: Turn the steering wheel in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
column8: If the vehicle has ABS, pump the pedal carefully.

column2: 9. In the following situations, drivers should increase their following interval:
column4: When following vehicles that are required to come to a stop at railroad crossings.
column6: When it is hard to see ahead because of bad weather.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 10. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, if the road you enter has two lanes, you:
column4: must turn into its right lane.
column6: must turn into its left lane.
column8: can not turn left.

column2: 11. After passing a vehicle, it is safe to return to your lane:
column4: when you see the front bumper of the other vehicle in your mirror.
column6: when you can no longer see the vehicle over your right shoulder.
column8: after about five seconds.

column2: 12. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: be ready to brake sharply and stop.
column6: yield to trucks coming from the hill on the right.
column8: be ready to shift to lower gear.

column2: 13. When a pedestrian is crossing a street guided carrying a white cane, drivers must:
column4: always yield the right-of-way.
column6: yield the right of way at corners only.
column8: help the pedestrian cross the street.

column2: 14. What is the meaning of blue traffic signs?
column4: Blue indicates road user services.
column6: They give directional information.
column8: Â A blue background indicates a regulatory sign.

column2: 15. This road sign means:
column4: Pedestrian crossing ahead
column6: Pedestrians must not cross here
column8: School zone ahead

column2: 16. If traffic on the other side of an intersection is backed up and you cannot get completely through, you must:
column4: wait until traffic ahead is clear.
column6: enter the intersection and try to avoid blocking it.
column8: enter the intersection and proceed with caution.

column2: 17. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they can not safely return to the right lane before any oncoming vehicle comes within 200 feet of them.
column6: their lane has a solid yellow center line.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 18. This warning sign:
column4: indicates the suggested highest safe speed.
column6: shows the current speed limit that all vehicles traveling in the direction of the arrow must not exceed.
column8: provides advance notice to upcoming speed limit change.

column2: 19. The golden rule of driving is to:
column4: put on your emergency flashers when driving at night.
column6: drive faster than the vehicle behind you.
column8: treat others the way you want to be treated.

column2: 20. This road sign tells drivers that:
column4: they must turn either to the right or left.
column6: they must change lane immediately.
column8: the one-way street or roadway ahead ends.

column2: 21. This sign means:
column4: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column6: A road crosses the main highway ahead.
column8: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.

column2: 22. A driver who approaches an intersection:
column4: must drive straight through the intersection, even if another vehicle is already in the intersection.
column6: must yield the right-of-way to traffic already in the intersection.
column8: has the right-of-way over traffic already in the intersection.

column2: 23. If your wheels drop off the pavement edge, you should:
column4: turn gradually back onto the roadway when safe.
column6: stop.
column8: turn back onto the roadway immediately.

column2: 24. If your brakes are wet, you can dry them by:
column4: pull over to the right and wait until it stops raining.
column6: having them checked by a mechanic.
column8: riding the pedal lightly.

column2: 25. This is the shape and color of a ________ sign.
column4: do not enter
column6: yield
column8: stop

column2: 26. This road sign means:
column4: Sharp right turn ahead.
column6: There is a series of sharp turns up ahead on the road
column8: A road joins from the right

column2: 27. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they approach the top of a hill on a two-way road and can not see over it.
column6: they can not safely return to the right lane before they reach a solid yellow center line for the right lane.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 28. On average, how long does it take your body to remove the alcohol contained in 5 ounces of wine?
column4: 30 minutes.
column6: 3 hours.
column8: one hour.

column2: 29. If a tire suddenly goes flat while you are driving, you should:
column4: slow down gradually do not apply the brake.
column6: apply the brake firmly and stop.
column8: pump the brake pedal 5-7 times until the vehicle stops.

column2: 30. What does a yellow arrow signal mean?
column4: Vehicles moving in all directions must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.
column6: The same as a green light.
column8: The same as the yellow light, but applies only to movement in the direction of the arrow.
